medical_history.chief_complaint: Abdominal pain localized to the right lower quadrant.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The abdominal pain began 1 day prior to presentation, initially diffuse and then localized to the right lower quadrant (RLQ). The pain is associated with nausea and significant vomiting, with no fever, chills, diarrhea, melena, or hematochezia. The patient had a bowel movement and passed flatus on the day of presentation. There were two similar episodes of pain over the summer and a couple of months ago that self-resolved.
